author: La Nazione
title: Parco eolico a Roccalbegna. Il Consiglio di Stato dice 'no'
text:
ROCCALBEGNASulla possibilità di costruire un impianto eolico a Podere di Moggino, vicino Roccalbegna, è arrivata la decisione, definitiva, del Consiglio di Stato . Impossibile. Ribaltando la sentenza di primo grado (Tribunale amministrativo regionale di Firenze), i giudici amministrativi capitolini hanno deciso che le numerose e puntuali eccezioni che erano state sollevate fin da subito dalla Soprintendenza , sulla possibilità di realizzare una simile struttura in una zona di pregio naturalistico e storico era ben fondate.
"Verrebbe realizzato - scrivono i giudici del Consiglio di Stato - in un’area confinante con una viabilità storica e con altre zone sottoposte a tutela". Non solo, nelle 29 pagine della sentenza, viene anche sottolineato che, come rilevato dalla Soprintendenza già in primo grado, si tratta di un "paesaggio molto composito e suggestivo e che anche per la sua altezza complessiva e modalità di costruzione - 77 metri quasi, con pale resa ben visibile da bande rosse e verdi alternate e per la presenza di luci di segnalazione – la struttura risulta molto visibile anche dalla strada provinciale a sud di Monte Buceto e dalla sommità del Monte Labbro".
Un pilastro questo che è alla base dell’accoglimento del ricorso sulla decisione del Tar Toscana, che era stato presentato dall’Unione dei Comuni Montanti Amiata Grossetana e dal Comune di Roccalbegna. Ricorso contro Regione, Arpat e Soprintendenza e nei confronti di Ewind 28, azienda che ha proposto la richiesta di autorizzazione per erigere l’impianto eolico. Ricorso, ovviamente, anche in riforma della decisione del Tribunale amministrativo regionale che aveva respinto, nel lontano 2022, ormai, il ricorso degli stessi enti. Questa volta, invece, a soccombere con una decisione che è definitiva, è la stessa azienda proponente e anche Regione e Arpat. Considerando, come hanno rilevato i giudici del Consiglio di Stato, che la Regione era riuscita a superare il parere negativo della Soprintendenza con un "percorso argomentativo - scrivono nella sentenza – e di asserito bilanciamento svolto che non è convincente, né sufficiente a superare le plurime criticità individuate nel parere della Soprintendenza".
Cristina Rufini

author: Lars Pollmann
title: Keine Chance unter Kompany: Bayern schickt nächstes Talent weg
text:
Keine Chance unter Kompany: Bayern schickt nächstes Talent weg
Der FC Bayern und seine Talentförderung – eine Dauerbaustelle. Nun sucht das nächste Juwel anderswo sein Glück, weil Vincent Kompany auf es verzichtet.
München – Der FC Bayern verpasst es offenbar erneut, auf ein eigenes Talent zu setzen. Youngster Nestory Irankunda steht vor einem Wechsel, weil er für die Profis als nicht gut genug erachtet wird – für die zweite Mannschaft aber zu stark ist.
2024 für über drei Millionen Euro als großes Versprechen aus Australien geholt, durfte Irankunda nie bei den Bayern-Profis ran. Für die Regionalliga-Mannschaft ist er überqualifiziert. Die Konsequenz: Irankunda steht vor einem permanenten Wechsel zum FC Watford in die zweite englische Liga.

author: @iHeartRadio
title: Florida Priest Bites Woman's Hand While Giving Out Holy Communion | iHeart
text:
Photo: Pascal Deloche / The Image Bank Unreleased / Getty Images
A woman got into a wild altercation with a priest during Mass at St. Thomas Aquinas Church in St. Cloud, Florida. The Diocese of Orlando said that the woman went to receive Holy Communion but "appeared unaware of the proper procedure."
Father Fidel Rodriguez briefly spoke to the woman before blessing her and telling her to go to confession before returning to receive Communion.
The woman left and returned for the 12 p.m. Mass. When she went to receive Communion, Father Rodriguez asked if she had received the Sacrament of the Penance, and she replied that it was none of his business.
The woman then reached into the Communion tray, grabbed the Communion hosts, and started crushing them. Father Rodriguez attempted to restrain the woman, but she refused to let go of the Communion hosts. During the struggle, the woman pushed Rodriguez. In response, he bit her on the hand .
The woman was then asked to leave the church.
Following the incident, the diocese defended Father Rodriguez's actions.
"Further, while the Diocese of Orlando does not condone physical altercations such as this, in good faith, Father Rodriguez was simply attempting to prevent an act of desecration of the Holy Communion, which, as a priest, Father Rodriguez is bound by duty to protect," the dioceses said in a statement.
When speaking to police, Father Rodriguez admitted what happened and said he was acting in self-defense .
"I bit her. I am not denying that. I was defending myself and the sacrament," Father Rodriguez told the officers.
No charges have been filed, but officials said that the incident remains under investigation.

author: VNExplorer
title: Scientist makes 'superionic' battery technology breakthrough that could transform the EV industry: 'Cheap, efficient, eco-friendly, and scalable'
text: Solid-state batteries could ensure around 621 miles of driving range on a single 10-minute charge. The growth of electric vehicles is hugely encouraging, helping to forge a path to a cleaner and more sustainable future. According to the International Energy Agency, 1.4 million EVs were registered in the United States in 2023, smashing all previous records and seeing a 40% rise when compared to 2022. While removing more dirty-fuel-powered vehicles from the roads will help reduce planet-warming pollution expelled from tailpipes and associated decreases in air quality, there are still some hurdles for EV battery technology to overcome. Lithium-ion batteries are most commonly used in EVs, but lithium is expensive, reasonably rare, and causes environmental damage from extraction. To further decrease the polluting impact of EVs, scientists are scrambling to find alternatives that don't have such negative implications for the Earth. That's why the work of a researcher at the Technical University of Denmark is so encouraging, culminating with the invention of a battery that can be made from rock silicates, one of the most common materials on the planet. As detailed by TechXplore, Mohamad Khoshkalam's research concludes that batteries based on potassium and sodium silicates are not sensitive to air or humidity and can be formed in "paper-like" structures that can be placed inside a battery. Watch now: Lime executive reveals true impact sustainable choices have had on business "The potential of potassium silicate as a solid-state electrolyte has been known for a long time, but in my opinion has been ignored due to challenges with the weight and size of the potassium ions," Khoshkalam told the publication. "The ions are large and therefore move slower." This means the ions don't move so quickly, which is not helpful for electrolyte conductivity. But Khoshkalam's "superionic" recipe can make ions move faster than even lithium-based electrolytes, delivering a "solid-state" solution that has been coveted by the EV industry. "We have shown that we can find a material for a solid-state electrolyte that is cheap, efficient, eco-friendly, and scalable — and that even performs better than solid-state lithium-based electrolytes," Khoshkalam said. While the breakthrough is promising, TechXplore expects it will be around 10 years before it gets utilized in electric vehicles, though a prototype might be ready in the next two years. But if progress is achieved and it can be produced at scale with few technological and safety issues, these solid-state batteries could ensure around 621 miles of driving range on a single 10-minute charge. EV companies like Toyota are working on solid-state battery technology with hopes to achieve a similar range and a quicker charging time. But the key to Khoshkalam's invention is the materials used, as they are far more abundant than the precious metals typically used in batteries and can be sourced for a lot less money. This could mean savings are passed on to consumers, making the cost of an electric car — which is already going down thanks to discounts available via the Inflation Reduction Act — much lower. With cost and driving range still among the biggest barriers to an EV purchase, these factors could make a huge difference in the buying habits of vehicle customers. Join our free newsletter for weekly updates on the coolest innovations improving our lives and saving our planet. Scientist makes 'superionic' battery technology breakthrough that could transform the EV industry: 'Cheap, efficient, eco-friendly, and scalable' first appeared on The Cool Down.

author: TJ Morin
title: Celtics to receive $23 million dollar NBA Finals star in proposed blockbuster trade
text:
Celtics to receive $23 million dollar NBA Finals star in proposed blockbuster trade
The Boston Celtics have been on a slippery slope recently, winning one game then losing the next. If they want to be repeat champions, they need to shake something up. A proposed trade by Boston Celtics on SI’s Gabe Smallson would have the C’s acquire Toronto Raptors wing Bruce Brown. The trade would look like this: Celtics get: Bruce Brown, Garrett Temple Raptors get: Jrue Holiday, 2025 second-rounder Holiday has been having his worst shooting year since 2017, and his contract is too large to keep for this kind of production. Brown was a crucial part of the Denver Nuggets’...

author: Admin
title: New Zealand E-Visa Program Expands to Welcome Brazilian, Canadian, Japanese, Mexican, and Portuguese Citizens
text:
In a significant move to enhance global connectivity and tourism, New Zealand proudly announces the expansion of its E-Visa program to include citizens from Brazil, Canada, Japan, Mexico, and Portugal. This strategic initiative aims to simplify the visa application process, promote cross-cultural exchanges, and strengthen diplomatic ties between New Zealand and these diverse nations.
New Zealand, renowned for its stunning landscapes, rich Maori culture, and vibrant cities, has long been a sought-after destination for global travelers. The introduction of the E-Visa program has proven instrumental in facilitating smoother entry for visitors, eliminating bureaucratic hurdles, and providing a more efficient means of obtaining travel authorization.
Since the implementation of the E-Visa program,
New Zealand Visa for Brazilian citizens now have the privilege of applying for New Zealand visas online. This electronic system expedites the application process, allowing Brazilians to experience the wonders of New Zealand for tourism, business, or any other purpose seamlessly. The move aligns with New Zealand’s commitment to fostering global partnerships and extending a warm welcome to visitors from diverse corners of the world.
A
New Zealand Visa for Canadian Citizens, New Zealand Visa for Japanese Citizens, New Zealand Visa for Mexican Citizens, and New Zealand Visa for Portuguese Citizens is not optional, but a mandatory requirement for all these citizens traveling to the country for short stays. Before traveling to New Zealand, a traveler needs to ensure that the validity of the passport is at least three months past the expected departure date.
The E-Visa application process is designed to be user-friendly, allowing citizens of Brazil, Canada, Japan, Mexico, and Portugal to navigate the platform with ease. The online application form captures essential details, streamlining the process and eliminating the need for traditional paper-based applications. This digital transformation not only enhances efficiency but also aligns with the global trend toward digital visa systems.
The E-Visa platform facilitates the seamless submission of required documents, reducing the burden on applicants. From proof of identity to travel itineraries, the digital system ensures that necessary documents are submitted electronically, eliminating the need for physical paperwork. This not only saves time but also contributes to a more environmentally friendly visa application process.
One of the notable advantages of the E-Visa program is the expedited processing time. Unlike traditional visa applications that may take weeks, the digital platform aims to provide quicker turnarounds. This is particularly beneficial for individuals with imminent travel plans, ensuring they receive their New Zealand E-Visa promptly.
The expansion of the E-Visa program to include citizens from Brazil, Canada, Japan, Mexico, and Portugal underscores New Zealand’s commitment to fostering global connectivity. This initiative goes beyond facilitating tourism; it serves as a bridge to strengthen diplomatic bonds, promote cultural understanding, and enhance international collaborations.
As New Zealand extends its E-Visa program to encompass citizens from diverse nations, a warm Kiwi welcome awaits travelers seeking to explore the country’s beauty, culture, and opportunities. The E-Visa initiative aligns with New Zealand’s values of inclusivity, innovation, and sustainability, setting the stage for a new era of seamless international travel.
The expansion of the New Zealand E-Visa program reflects the country’s global vision for travel. By embracing digital advancements, New Zealand aims to provide a more accessible, efficient, and transparent visa application process. As citizens of Brazil, Canada, Japan, Mexico, and Portugal embark on their journeys to New Zealand, they are invited to partake in the enriching experiences that await them in this land of unparalleled beauty and hospitality.

author: Zonebourse
title: Vodafone signe un accord avec RWE pour l'énergie éolienne offshore en Allemagne -Le 16 février 2024 à 09:54 | Zonebourse
text:
(Alliance News) - Les éoliennes offshore de la mer du Nord alimenteront environ 12 000 tours du réseau cellulaire de Vodafone Group PLC à travers l'Allemagne dans le cadre d'un nouvel accord que le fournisseur de téléphonie mobile a conclu avec la société énergétique allemande RWE AG.
Vodafone, société de télécommunications basée à Berkshire, en Angleterre, exploite un total d'environ 26 000 pylônes en Allemagne.
Le parc éolien en mer, baptisé Kaskasi, fournira un total de 250 gigawattheures par an à partir de 2026, ont annoncé les deux entreprises vendredi à Düsseldorf. Le contrat de fourniture d'électricité a une durée de 10 ans.
En contrepartie, Vodafone a installé une station radio mobile offshore spéciale dans le parc éolien, situé à environ 35 kilomètres au nord de l'île allemande de Helgoland, en mer du Nord, qui connectera les techniciens sur place ainsi que des drones et des capteurs.
Les drones d'inspection seront contrôlés en temps réel à l'aide de la connexion par téléphone mobile afin de détecter à un stade précoce d'éventuelles défaillances techniques sur les éoliennes.
Des capteurs de santé humaine en réseau pourraient également accroître la sécurité des employés sur le site, ont déclaré les entreprises.
"Nous apportons des communications mobiles 5G modernes en mer pour soutenir la production d'énergie éolienne en Allemagne", a déclaré Philippe Rogge, qui dirige Vodafone Allemagne.
Ulf Kerstin, directeur de RWE, a déclaré que Kaskasi était désormais le sixième parc éolien de RWE en mer du Nord allemande, et qu'il était prévu de construire un autre groupe de turbines au nord de l'île-barrière de Juist, qui produira 1,6 gigawatt d'électricité.
Les actions de Vodafone ont chuté de 1,2 % à 65,80 pence chacune vendredi matin à Londres, tandis que les actions de RWE étaient en baisse de 0,9 % à 32,00 euros chacune à Francfort.
source : dpa

author: Jeremy Dick
title: Mighty Ducks Fan Favorite Shaun Weiss Reunites With Co-Stars After Missing Out on Disney+ Sequel Series
text:
Former child star Shaun Weiss missed out on reuniting with his Mighty Ducks co-stars in the sequel series that streamed on Disney+. However, he's now gotten his chance to reunite with several of his co-stars from the movies in new photos posted online.
On Instagram, Weiss, who played Greg Goldberg in the Mighty Ducks films, shared some new photos of himself at Eerie Culture Fest in Ohio, where he appeared as a celebrity guest. Fellow Mighty Ducks stars who were present were Aaron Schwartz (Dave Karp, The Mighty Ducks), Matt Doherty (Lester Averman, The Mighty Ducks 1-3), and Marguerite Moreau (Connie Moreau, The Mighty Ducks 1-3); Weiss and Schwartz also co-starred in Heavyweights. Weiss posted photos of himself with each of these actors, along with another image of himself with fellow former child star Jonathan Lipnicki (Stuart Little, Jerry McGuire). The images can be seen below.
Related
'We Don't Want to Pursue That': Emilio Estevez Describes His Mighty Ducks 4 Script Rejected by Disney
Estevez, who starred as Coach Gordon Bombay in all three Mighty Ducks movies, shares plot details for the rejected film.
Doherty and Moreau were two of a handful of original Mighty Ducks trilogy stars to appear for a reunion in the Disney+ sequel series, The Mighty Ducks: Game Changers. Other originals who appeared in the show include Elden Henson (Fulton Reed), Garette Henson (Guy Germaine), Vincent A. LaRusso (Adam Banks), and Justin Wong (Ken Wu). In 2023, the show was canceled after two seasons and later removed from streaming from Disney+. If the show was renewed for a third season, it's possible that Weiss could have gotten a chance to reprise his role as Goldberg, as he had just returned to acting after a long hiatus right when Game Changers was given the ax at Disney+.
Shaun Weiss Has Returned to Performing
While the unfortunate timing may have caused Weiss to miss out on the TV show, fans may still be happy to know he's getting other opportunities to see his old friends from the Mighty Ducks films. It may also be wonderful for many to see Weiss doing so well at this point in his life following years of struggles. After growing up as a child star, Weiss started to drift away from acting as he got older, and after a small role in 2008's Drillbit Taylor, he disappeared from the screen.
Related
[
'Not Sure [Disney's] Aware They Made It': Ben Stiller Reflects On Controversial Comedy 30 Years Later
](/heavyweights-ben-stiller-disney-tweet/)
Ben Stiller addresses the 30th anniversary of his Disney comedy that has been subjected to retroactive controversy.
In the following years, Weiss struggled with houselessness, substance abuse, and legal troubles. He seemingly hit rock bottom following an arrest in January 2020, and fans were shocked to see the former child star looking unrecognizable when new images hit the web. A fundraiser was launched by a friend to help get Weiss back on his feet, with many fans across the world contributing, and he has stayed sober ever since, celebrating five years clean in January. He announced the month prior that he's expecting to be a father after learning that his girlfriend, Shannon, was pregnant. The two also stated they're planning to get married.
Meanwhile, Weiss has also resumed his work as an entertainer. He had a role in 2023's Jesus Revolution, officially putting him back on the screen to revive his acting career. Weiss has also been performing stand-up comedy.
Source: Shaun Weiss on Instagram
For anyone who needs assistance with substance abuse, the SAMHSA helpline can be reached at 1-800-662-HELP. More information can be found on the official website.

author: NOLAN LISTER nolan.lister@helenair.com
title: Cities, county look to seize opioid grant dollars
text: The Helena City Commission has approved the creation of a committee with Lewis and Clark County and East Helena to review and recommend proposals for spending the state's opioid settlement funds. The city's unanimous approval given during Monday's regular meeting falls in lockstep with the county commission, which approved the same measure during its Jan. 18 meeting. The Montana Opioid Abatement Trust, or MOAT, is expected to receive more than $75 million over the next 18 years as part of the multi-state settlements reached with Teva, Allergan, CVS, Walgreens and Walmart. The dollars will be funneled to local communities for projects that expand access to addiction treatments, recovery services, education programs and law enforcement initiatives related to opioids. As a result, the state has been divided into five "multi-county abatement regions" and nine "metro abatement regions," one of which is the Lewis and Clark Metro Abatement Region, all required to set up their own "governance structure" to review and recommend proposed uses for the money to the trust. People are also reading… The memorandum of understanding between the local governing bodies establishes that governance structure in the form of a local trust advisory committee. The local committee will include five members, three elected officials from Helena, East Helena and Lewis and Clark County in addition to two citizen representatives from Helena and the county as appointed by their respective commissions. The cities and county will provide administrative assistance to the group. The memorandum will remain in effect for the next three years. Lewis and Clark County Public Health Officer Drenda Niemann told the city commission during a Nov. 29 administrative meeting that the cities and counties will also receive direct funds as a result of the settlement in addition to the state dollars being held in the trust. Niemann has been designated a MOAT trustee to represent the local metropolitan region. She said each municipality and county has a designated percentage of trust dollars for which they can apply to receive through a grant portal, which is expected to open within the next three months. "I just want to make sure that both the city of Helena and Lewis and Clark County have those boxes checked before that portal opens because I don't want us to miss out on an opportunity to apply for those designated funds to come and help do opioid prevention work in our community," Niemann said. She also said as a trustee she will acknowledge a conflict of interest when local applications are reviewed and abstain from voting. "The city's designated percentage is less than the county's overall, but both together could do some good work," Niemann said. Lewis and Clark County Grants and Purchasing Director Ann McCauley told the county commissioners during their Jan. 18 meeting that nonprofits, hospitals and school districts are also eligible applicants. McCauley said the county's designated percentage of the pot is estimated to be about $5 million in total over the next 18 years with about $600,000 presently available to the region. "The trust funds are going to keep coming in every year, and as more settlements are settled, there will be additional funding, but that's kind of an unknown right now, how much more money that's going to be for the state," she said. Lewis and Clark County Commissioner Tom Rolfe said the estimates show a potential for about $250,000 a year to come to the county for opioid abatement. "It's going to go up or down depending on the settlements, but each year it could be a substantial amount to work towards helping folks with problems with addiction to opioids, so it's nothing to sneeze at," Rolfe said.
